iep_goals: Demonstrate appropriate social interactions with peers during structured activities in 4 out of 5 opportunities
Complete written assignments with proper sentence structure and grammar with 80% accuracy in 3 out of 4 trials
Follow multi-step directions independently with visual supports in 8 out of 10 opportunities
Maintain focus during instruction for 15-minute intervals with 75% success rate
Use appropriate coping strategies when frustrated with 85% success rate
Participate in group discussions by contributing relevant comments in 3 out of 4 opportunities
accommodations: Movement breaks every 20 minutes (Across all instructional environments)
Preferential seating-near teacher and away from high-traffic areas (Across all instructional environments)
Use of fidget tools and sensory supports (GEN ED/SSC)
Visual schedule and task lists (GEN ED/SSC)
Modified ELA testing with reduced writing requirements
Standard Math testing with extended time
individual instruction twice a week for 30 minutes
social skills training in small group setting
learning_styles: learns through movement and kinesthetic activities
benefits from clear routines and expectations
needs frequent breaks to maintain attention
placement: 75% time in regular class & extracurricular & non academic activities, 25% time outside regular class

interviews.parent: Parent reported student has been diagnosed with autism and ADHD. Enjoys routine and has special interests in trains and maps. Lives with both parents and older sister.
interviews.teacher: Student is very bright but struggles with social interactions and transitions. Works best with clear expectations and visual supports.

observations.psychologist: Student demonstrates above-average cognitive abilities but shows challenges with executive functioning and social communication. Benefits from structured environment.
